Inn-Flow Lands $45 Million Investment to Drive Innovation and Expansion of Hotel Back-Office Automation Platform
Source: Hotel Technology News    Published: 2025-03-25 01:52:35

A low-profile yet fast-growing technology solution provider based in Cary, North Carolina is making waves in the hotel industry. Inn-Flow, a company providing integrated back-office management software for the hotel industry, has secured a $45 million growth capital investment from Mainsail Partners, a San Francisco-based private equity firm specializing in vertical SaaS. The funding marks the company's first institutional investment and sets the stage for major expansion across product, people, and market reach. Founded in 2009 by John Erhart, a hospitality industry veteran with deep roots in hotel ownership through his family's company, CMC Hotels, Inn-Flow began as a solution to streamline operations within the family business. The platform officially launched to the broader industry in 2014, quickly gaining traction among hotel owners and operators seeking better tools to manage increasingly complex operations. Fast forward to today, and Inn-Flow has evolved into a comprehensive, cloud-based platform designed specifically for hotel management companies. The software offers a suite of integrated modules covering accounting and bookkeeping, payroll, labor management, procurement, sales tracking, bank reconciliation, and business intelligence. These tools empower hotel operators to automate routine tasks, improve decision-making, control labor costs, and scale more efficiently. In 2024 alone, Inn-Flow reportedly processed over 920,000 invoices, managed $2.7 billion in payables, and reconciled nearly 5,000 bank accounts across its customer base. It also supported over 100,000 labor-management users, tracking nearly 15 million labor hours and overseeing payroll volume in excess of $200 million. These metrics underscore the platform's growing impact on operational performance and financial visibility within the hospitality sector. “This investment is a major milestone for our team and our customers,” said John Erhart, Founder and CEO of Inn-Flow in a statement. “We are committed to providing a robust, user-friendly platform that enables hotel owners and management companies to simplify their operations and grow their businesses profitably. Mainsail's experience in scaling vertical SaaS companies will help us take Inn-Flow to the next level.” The investment will reportedly be used to accelerate product innovation, enhance customer experience, and expand the company's team, including the planned hiring of at least 20 new employees in the Cary area over the next 18 months. Mainsail's strategic support will also help Inn-Flow expand its presence in new market segments and further differentiate its platform in an increasingly competitive space. As part of its expansion strategy, Inn-Flow will reportedly roll out new product offerings in the coming months, including solutions for facilities management, mobile access, and advanced business intelligence. These new capabilities aim to help hoteliers operate more efficiently, stay ahead of the technology curve, and ultimately drive higher profitability. The hotel industry's push toward digital transformation—fueled by rising labor costs, leaner teams, and increased demand for automation—has created fertile ground for platforms like Inn-Flow. With a strong foundation, loyal customer base, and now, significant financial backing, the company is well-positioned to become a dominant force in hotel back-office technology. From a family-owned hotel solution to a national leader in hospitality SaaS, Inn-Flow's journey is a compelling case study in how industry insiders can drive innovation by solving problems from the inside out. Coast Hotels Taps Infor to Help Streamline Operations, Maximize Profitability and Exceed Guest Expectations Hotel Technology News - Weekly Dispatch Want to stay smart, keep current on restaurant technology, too? Source: PR Newswire    Published: 2025-03-25 16:05:00

Searching for your content... In-Language News Contact Us 888-776-0942 from 8 AM - 10 PM ET Mar 25, 2025, 12:05 ET Share this article Jarrard Inc. welcomes industry veteran to lead Market Research & Insights team NASHVILLE, Tenn., March 25, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Jarrard Inc., a U.S. Top 10 healthcare strategic communications and change management consultancy, is pleased to announce the addition of Jed Lam as Senior Vice President, Market Research & Insights. With more than 25 years of experience leading research-driven brand strategy and marketing communications, Lam deepens Jarrard's capability to deliver sophisticated, data-driven insights to healthcare organizations navigating reputational, branding and strategic hurdles. Lam joined Jarrard in March from Edelman where he served as Executive Vice President, Head of US Central Region for Edelman Data & Intelligence and led a team of research managers, scientists and analysts. "As we continue expanding our Market Research & Insights practice, bringing in a leader like Jed is a game-changer," said Jarrard Inc. President and Co-Founder Anne Hancock Toomey. "Healthcare organizations are under immense pressure to make decisions with clarity and confidence, and Jed's deep expertise positions us to provide even more precise, data-driven guidance to our clients." The Jarrard Market Research & Insights (MRI) group specializes in understanding the interplay of stakeholder perceptions, motivations and behaviors – the literal and people politics that permeate healthcare – and the messaging that will drive impact. The MRI team explores the right questions and develops solutions to deliver critical wins with measurable results. Over Lam's distinguished career, he has worked with a myriad of Fortune 100 clients and leading healthcare organizations including Advocate Health, the American Cancer Society, the Arthritis Foundation, CMS, Lurie Children's Hospital, Humana and Walgreens. "I'm thrilled to join the powerhouse team at Jarrard as we aim to supercharge all the great work already happening with the latest advancements in utilizing research and data to make healthcare better," Lam said. Additional New Hires "Continuously expanding our team with top talent allows us to strengthen our impact with clients and advance our mission of supporting healthcare leaders in high-stakes times with best-in-class strategic counsel," Toomey said. Rounding out the latest additions to the Jarrard team of almost 100 professionals are: About Jarrard Inc. Jarrard Inc. is a specialized healthcare consulting firm devoted to helping leaders during high-stakes moments of change, challenge and opportunity. We use the power of communications, marketing and political strategy to help our clients achieve their most important goals. Founded in 2006, the firm has worked with more than 1,800 clients in 48 states and focuses on change management, issues and advocacy and strategic positioning. Evinova, Quantum Leap Healthcare Collaborative announce partnership
Source: Mobihealth News    Published: 2025-03-25 15:38:15

Photo: Geber86/Getty Images Evinova, a clinical trial technology company, is partnering with Quantum Leap Healthcare Collaborative (QLHC) to integrate Evinova's remote patient monitoring (RPM) offering into I-SPY 2.2, a platform trial that provides a framework to study multiple novel therapeutic treatment arms for women with newly diagnosed, locally advanced breast cancer. A platform trial is a clinical trial design that allows for the simultaneous evaluation of multiple interventions or treatments against a common control group within a single, ongoing protocol that could lead to efficient and adaptable research. Evinova's RPM module will be used to warn healthcare professionals of early symptoms of interstitial lung disease (ILD), a possible adverse event for one treatment arm in the study. Evinova's RPM allows for real-time monitoring of patients' health status and treatment intake between clinical visits and notifies healthcare providers of the potential onset or worsening of symptoms related to a potential toxicity, specifically ILD. With this data, healthcare providers can triage patients requiring further clinical evaluation and intervene quickly based on guidelines. According to Evinova, this could potentially reduce the likelihood of progression to high-grade ILD and dose reduction, hold or interruption of treatment. "One of the primary goals of I-SPY 2.2 is to get better treatments to patients faster and with fewer side effects," Dr. Laura Esserman, founder of the I-SPY trials and QLHC, said in a statement. "New bispecific antibodies and antibody drug conjugates have the promise of eliminating traditional chemotherapy, but they too are associated with potential serious side effects. One of those complications is ILD, but early identification may be the key to preventing it from becoming a serious complication. Evinova makes it possible for us to monitor people using the drug every day, from the comfort of their home." Cristina Duran, president of Evinova, said that with real-time alerts to both patients and sites, Evinova's RPM solution for toxicity monitoring will give care teams the ability to review and take proactive actions based on guidelines. "At Evinova, we're passionate about accelerating better health outcomes through technology like RPM that enables global life science leaders to overcome critical research challenges and deliver a better clinical trial experience for both sites and patients," Duran said. THE LARGER TREND In 2023, AstraZeneca launched Evinova with the aim of bringing digital health solutions already in use globally by the pharma company to clinical research organizations, trial sponsors, and care teams and patients. The company uses established digital technology solutions to streamline clinical trial design and delivery in order to reduce time and costs in medicine development. The venture also dives into digital remote patient monitoring and therapeutics. Other companies involved in remote patient monitoring include Sibel Health, a spin-out of Northwestern University, which closed a $30 million Series C equity financing round in March and received its seventh FDA clearance. Sibel Health's FDA-cleared ANNE One platform contains advanced wearable sensors, AI-enabled data analytics, and an integrated mobile software and cloud platform. It also offers wireless monitoring of patients' vital signs and can be used for patients 12 years and older. In 2024, Doccla, a provider of virtual ward and remote patient monitoring services, secured £35 million ($38.6 million) in an oversubscribed Series B funding round. That same year, CoachCare secured a $48 million strategic growth investment. CoachCare works with individual practices and hospital systems to provide a remote patient monitoring service for patients with acute and chronic conditions, and it offers connected devices for providers to capture patient data. The company also provides a virtual health platform for follow-ups and chronic care management. © 2025 MobiHealthNews is a publication of HIMSS Media MobiHealthNews: The latest news in digital health delivered daily to your inbox.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA 1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


DeepIntent Unveils DeepIntent Cortex™, Ushering in the Next Generation of Healthcare Demand Side Platforms
Source: PR Newswire    Published: 2025-03-25 14:30:00

Searching for your content... In-Language News Contact Us 888-776-0942 from 8 AM - 10 PM ET Mar 25, 2025, 10:30 ET Share this article NEW YORK, March 25, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- DeepIntent, the leading healthcare advertising technology company, today introduced DeepIntent Cortex, its most advanced demand side platform (DSP) upgrade to date. Inspired by the human brain's ability to process complex information, DeepIntent Cortex seamlessly integrates artificial intelligence (AI) with real-time media buying and daily-refreshed health data, delivering an intuitive, Health Intelligent™ media buying experience that elevates speed, choice, precision, and scale like never before. The result of nearly two years of product development, DeepIntent Cortex meets the industry's growing demand for more personalized ad experiences by connecting marketing performance to real-world health outcomes at every stage of a campaign. With streamlined workflows and secure access to health data, Cortex leverages AI-powered Health Intelligence to enhance efficiency across digital channels and deliver actionable health and media insights that drive more strategic media investments. "DeepIntent Cortex gives healthcare marketers a decisive edge by seamlessly connecting campaign performance with real-world health outcomes," said Chris Paquette, Founder and CEO of DeepIntent. "By accelerating access to critical data and insights, Cortex sets a new standard for data-driven marketing by empowering marketers with advanced tools, AI-driven Health Intelligence, and access to our industry's most premium data and media. With enhanced speed, precision, and scale, brands can optimize performance, adapt with agility, and drive superior results in an increasingly competitive market." Key Enhancements of DeepIntent Cortex A Streamlined UX Built for Speed, Insight, and Action Built for and with programmatic traders in healthcare, Cortex accelerates campaign management by uniting health and media insights into a seamless workflow. AI-driven automation reduces campaign management and optimization time by up to 50%, enabling faster decision-making and execution. Unparalleled Access to Premium Health Data Backed by significant investment in a privacy-centric data infrastructure, Cortex offers direct access to a premium marketplace of health and media data. Clients can explore insights and select their preferred health data provider to power all aspects of their campaign, including campaign planning and optimization. Precise Health Intelligent Optimization DeepIntent's patented real-time DeepIntent Outcomes™ optimization uses real-world clinical and media data to optimize bidding, ensuring ad spend is directed toward high-impact impressions that drive script lift and improve patient outcomes. DeepIntent Cortex enhances this methodology, delivering a 25% improvement—raising the average audience quality (AQ) lift by 80% in initial testing. Additionally, it introduces Predictive AQ Optimization, empowering traders to visualize the impact of AQ optimization before buying media. This innovation maximizes working media investment through AI-supported decision-making that can lead to better outcomes and more relevant patient engagement. Scaled Audience Access with HealthFirst™ Packages In healthcare advertising, scale is only valuable when it is relevant. Cortex delivers this with new HealthFirst™ Packages, curated marketplaces that provide seamless access to premium endemic inventory and connected TV (CTV) placements. By leveraging strategic publisher partnerships, these packages—enhanced by Health Intelligent targeting and optimization—ensure advertisers reach high-value healthcare audiences with precision and impact. Enhanced Healthcare Provider (HCP) Capabilities Cortex elevates HCP media strategy with end-to-end enhancements, including advanced tools for audience analytics and insights, in-platform AI-driven recommendations for campaign optimization, and a new NPI-based site analytics dashboard integrated into DeepIntent Outcomes™ for a comprehensive view of HCP engagement. "After nearly two years of development, DeepIntent Cortex is a true breakthrough—bringing seamless, data-driven media buying to the healthcare industry," said Aaron Fulmer, SVP of Product at DeepIntent. "By integrating health and media insights into every stage of the buying process, Cortex not only saves traders valuable time but also ensures smarter, more effective campaign execution. It marks a major step forward for digital healthcare advertising." Unveiling DeepIntent Cortex at AdLab DeepIntent is unveiling Cortex today at its AdLab event in New York City, featuring a distinguished lineup of industry leaders, including Chris Paquette, Founder and CEO of DeepIntent; Melissa Gordon-Ring, Global President of IPG Mediabrands Health; Matt McNally, Global CEO of Publicis Health; Kevin Kammeyer, Director of Media Strategy & Operations at Gilead; Erin Nocito, Executive Director, Head of Global Media at Amgen; and other key voices shaping the future of health advertising. Learn more about DeepIntent Cortex here. About DeepIntent DeepIntent is the health advertising platform marketers trust to drive effective campaigns. Purpose-built for healthcare and privacy-safe, the DeepIntent platform unites media and clinical data to produce industry-defining Health Intelligence. Consistently proven to deliver real-world results through real-time optimization, the DeepIntent platform powers more than 600 pharmaceutical brands and all the leading healthcare agencies—enabling them to innovate, differentiate, and reach their audiences across all channels and devices. For more information, visit DeepIntent.com or follow us on LinkedIn. Source: PR Newswire    Published: 2025-03-25 14:26:00

Searching for your content... In-Language News Contact Us 888-776-0942 from 8 AM - 10 PM ET Mar 25, 2025, 10:26 ET Share this article The world's leading science-backed longevity membership is opening its newest wellness center location in Houston, Texas HOUSTON, March 25, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Fountain Life, the leading science-backed longevity company committed to proactive and data-driven global health care, today announced the scheduled October 2025 opening of its fifth precision diagnostic center, designed to help members achieve optimal health, in Houston, Texas. Fountain Life uses groundbreaking technology to offer AI-driven diagnostics, personalized health plans, and a dedicated support team, alongside advanced therapeutics that help detect potential illnesses such as cancer, cardiac issues, metabolic disorders, and neurodegenerative diseases. Their proactive approach has identified potentially life-threatening conditions in 14% of seemingly healthy members, and thanks to early detection, these conditions are now fully actionable. Fountain Life uses groundbreaking technology to offer AI-driven diagnostics, personalized health plans, and a dedicated support team, alongside advanced therapeutics that help detect potential illnesses such as cancer, cardiac issues, metabolic disorders, and neurodegenerative diseases. Their proactive approach has identified potentially life-threatening conditions in 14% of seemingly healthy members, and thanks to early detection, these conditions are now fully actionable. "Our world is undergoing a healthspan revolution, and at Fountain Life, we are at the forefront of unlocking deeper insights into the human body," said William Kapp, MD, CEO of Fountain Life. "Advances in AI, genomics, gene therapy, and cellular medicine are revealing the secrets of aging—empowering us to slow, stop, and even reverse its effects—and our next step is introducing these opportunities to the Houston community." With existing state-of-the-art centers in Florida, Texas, and New York, the new Houston center is the second location opening in Texas, driven by the popularity of the Dallas center. The center will be located in the acclaimed Park House Houston building, home to a dynamic array of social experiences, culinary offerings, fine art, cultural events and more. "At Park House, our mission is to provide members with exceptional experiences that enhance their well-being and quality of life," said Brady Wood, CEO of Woodhouse and Co-Founder, Co-Operator of Park House. "With Fountain Life opening within our building, we're bringing cutting-edge preventative health directly to our community, ensuring our members have access to the best resources to live longer, healthier lives." As interest for wellness solutions continues to grow globally, Fountain Life has future plans to expand even further. "Experts predict that this decade's medical breakthroughs could extend our health span by decades. Our mission is to ensure our members worldwide stay healthy and fully benefit from these longevity advancements," said Kapp. "We are only at the beginning of the journey." For more information on Fountain Life and its membership options, visit www.fountainlife.com. About Fountain LifeFountain Life is the world's leading science-backed longevity center, powered by AI. They bring together a dedicated team of longevity physicians, health coaches, and nutritionists with AI-powered diagnostics to identify and treat life-threatening diseases early, devise personalized health optimization plans, and provide 24/7 concierge medical care. Additionally, Fountain Life members have access to cutting-edge regenerative therapies designed to combat the effects of aging. We invite you to learn more at www.fountainlife.com. WoodHouse owns and operates Park House Dallas and Houston, chef-driven Mexican restaurant José, Dior Café by Dominique Crenn in Dallas' Highland Park Village, Citizen House Oklahoma City, Elevation Hotel & Spa in Crested Butte, Pilgrimage Music Festival, and The Moore Miami, a luxury private members club, workspace, and hotel in the Miami Design District. For more information, visit www.woodhouseus.com. Are mobile health clinics for Sacramento's homeless effective? County to review
Source: Sacramento Bee    Published: 2025-03-25 14:00:00

Sacramento County's Department of Health Services seeks to gain more grant funding to provide health care for homeless people. Staff will present at the Board of Supervisors meeting Tuesday about their mobile and street medical service called Wellness Without Walls. These mobile clinics have a variety of healthcare services, including HIV treatment, testing for sexually transmitted diseases and substance counseling, according to Sacramento County Department of Health Services' website. In partnership with the department's primary health services and sexual health promotion unit, the program was created to eliminate barriers to accessing health care. Homeless residents don't always have transportation needed for a doctor's visit, or they fear losing their belongings while away at a clinic. These mobile clinics attempt to bridge the gap of accessing health care, the resolution states. “These programs not only address immediate health concerns but also build trust within the unhoused community, encouraging individuals to seek ongoing care,” the resolution states. Originally established in 2014, there are currently three mobile clinics and one dental clinic, the department stated. These mobile clinics have primary care services for clients as young as 4 years old. They also have wound care equipment and labs and medical referrals. The Department of Health Services stated that this program has served more than 2,000 patients since its launch. The Department of Health Services wants to expand services through providing additional locations in Sacramento County, according to the presentation prepared for the Board of Supervisors. Many of the mobile clinics work in silos and Medi-Cal resources can be restrictive, with clients facing difficulties meeting criteria. The agency added the program has faced obstacles with getting care for uninsured clients. Consistency with client follow-up has also been met with difficulty. Wellness Without Walls holds pop-up medical clinics throughout the county. Tuesday, the day of the presentation to the Board of Supervisors, the a clinic will be 9 a.m. - noon at 1492 Northgate Blvd. Upcoming locations can be found at https://bit.ly/4jivLR9 Only 44¢ per day Real-time updates and all local stories you want right in the palm of your hand. Part of the McClatchy Media Network
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA 1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


My Ayur Health: Transforming Healthcare Through Ayurveda Innovation
Source: Markets Insider    Published: 2025-03-25 13:59:09

My Ayur Health: Transforming Healthcare Through Ayurveda Innovation. Virginia, United States, March 25, 2025 -- In the ever-evolving landscape of healthcare, the demand for holistic and natural healing methods has seen a dramatic rise. My Ayur Health, https://myayurhealth.com/, co-founded by Nandhakumar Raju and Dr. Mishra, is at the forefront of this transformation, offering an innovative platform that integrates the timeless wisdom of Ayurveda with cutting-edge technology. The platform aims to make Ayurvedic medicine accessible and affordable to people worldwide, addressing a critical gap in the healthcare ecosystem. By providing a comprehensive marketplace for virtual consultations, personalized health assessments, and natural remedies, My Ayur Health is redefining how people approach their health and well-being. The Timeless Wisdom of Ayurveda Ayurveda, often referred to as the "Science of Life," is one of the world's oldest medical systems, originating in India over 5,000 years ago. It emphasizes a holistic approach to health, focusing on the balance between mind, body, and spirit to achieve overall well-being. Unlike conventional medicine, which often focuses on treating symptoms, Ayurveda seeks to identify and address the root cause of ailments. With its reliance on natural remedies, dietary guidance, and lifestyle modifications, Ayurveda has proven to be effective in managing chronic conditions such as diabetes, arthritis, stress, and digestive disorders. Despite its proven benefits, access to qualified Ayurvedic practitioners and authentic treatments remains a challenge for many, particularly in the modern era where fast-paced lifestyles often compromise holistic health practices. Challenges in Modern HealthcareThe global healthcare system is grappling with numerous challenges, from rising costs to the growing prevalence of chronic diseases. Allopathy, the predominant system of medicine, while highly effective for acute and emergency care, often falls short in addressing the long-term management of chronic conditions. Additionally, the reliance on synthetic drugs has led to widespread concerns about side effects and over-medication. In developing nations, accessibility to quality healthcare remains a significant hurdle, while in developed countries, the focus on quick fixes often overshadows the importance of preventive and holistic care. These challenges have highlighted the need for alternative approaches that prioritize prevention, affordability, and accessibility, a gap that My Ayur Health aims to fill. Nandhakumar Raju: Visionary Leadership and ContributionAs a co-founder of My Ayur Health, Nandhakumar Raju has played a pivotal role in shaping the platform's vision and mission. Recognizing the untapped potential of Ayurveda in addressing global healthcare challenges, Nandhakumar has worked tirelessly to create a platform that bridges the gap between traditional healing practices and modern healthcare needs. With over two decades of experience in the technology sector and an MBA in Healthcare Management, he combines deep technical expertise with a strategic understanding of the healthcare industry. Additionally, his current role at a top multinational healthcare technology organization has given him valuable insights into the complexities and opportunities in the global healthcare landscape. Nandhakumar's vision goes beyond just creating a platform; it's about fostering a community that values holistic health and well-being. His extensive background in technology and entrepreneurial leadership has enabled him to design and implement innovative solutions that enhance user experience and operational efficiency. By leveraging his expertise, Nandhakumar has introduced cutting-edge digital solutions to My Ayur Health, making Ayurvedic consultations and treatments accessible to people across the globe, eliminating geographical barriers, and streamlining user interactions. In addition to his technical acumen, Nandhakumar is deeply committed to enhancing healthcare accessibility. He has driven efforts to onboard certified Ayurvedic practitioners, ensuring the platform maintains the highest quality standards. His strategic partnerships have expanded My Ayur Health's offerings to include personalized health assessments, virtual consultations, and dietary recommendations.Dr. Mishra: A Visionary Co-Founder and Healthcare PioneerDr. Bibhu R. Misra, a pioneering co-founder of My Ayur Health, is a distinguished leader in integrative and holistic healthcare with an extensive background in chiropractic care, rehabilitative medicine, clinical research, and pharmaceutical sciences. His ability to bridge modern medical science with Ayurvedic principles makes My Ayur Health a cutting-edge platform that blends evidence-based Western medicine with time-honored Eastern healing traditions. Transforming Lives: Accessible and Affordable HealthcareMy Ayur Health has emerged as a beacon of hope for individuals seeking a natural and holistic approach to healthcare. The platform's user-friendly interface allows individuals to connect with experienced Ayurvedic doctors for virtual consultations, making expert advice accessible from the comfort of their homes. This accessibility is particularly beneficial for people in remote areas who may not have access to qualified practitioners. Affordability is another cornerstone of My Ayur Health. By offering cost-effective solutions, the platform ensures that quality healthcare is within reach for people from all walks of life. The integration of technology has further streamlined the process, reduced overhead costs and enabled users to access personalized health plans and remedies at a fraction of the cost of conventional treatments. Moreover, My Ayur Health empowers individuals to take charge of their health by providing them with the knowledge and tools to make informed decisions. From dietary and lifestyle recommendations to natural remedies for chronic conditions, the platform equips users with practical solutions that promote long-term well-being. The success stories of users who have experienced significant improvements in their health stand as a testament to the platform's impact. Why My Ayur Health is UniqueMy Ayur Health is a first-of-its-kind platform that revolutionizes how Ayurveda is practiced and accessed worldwide. Unlike traditional Ayurvedic clinics or fragmented online resources, My Ayur Health offers a comprehensive and seamless digital ecosystem. It combines the ancient wisdom of Ayurveda with the precision of modern technology to deliver highly personalized, affordable, and easily accessible healthcare solutions. Additionally, the platform's innovative use of technology, such as AI-powered health assessments and user-friendly interfaces, sets it apart as a trailblazer in the healthcare sector. Co-founders Nandhakumar Raju and Dr. Mishra have combined their extensive expertise to create a platform that redefines healthcare by blending traditional and modern approaches, making My Ayur Health a beacon of transformation in holistic medicine. ConclusionIn a world where healthcare challenges continue to grow, My Ayur Health stands as a transformative force, bridging the gap between traditional and modern medicine. By making Ayurveda accessible, affordable, and effective, the platform addresses the limitations of conventional healthcare while championing a holistic approach to well-being. Co-founders Nandhakumar Raju and Dr. Mishra bring complementary expertise to this mission. Nandhakumar's visionary leadership and two decades of technology experience, coupled with his MBA in Healthcare Management, have been pivotal in driving the platform's technological innovation and strategic growth. Dr. Mishra's deep knowledge of chiropractic care and holistic medicine has enriched the platform with a patient-centered approach to healing. Together, they have created a platform that integrates cutting-edge technology with the timeless wisdom of Ayurveda, making natural healthcare solutions available to people around the globe. Through their collaborative efforts, My Ayur Health empowers individuals to embrace a healthier, more balanced lifestyle. By providing accessible, affordable, and personalized healthcare options, the platform is not only transforming lives but also contributing to a more sustainable and equitable healthcare system. Contact Info: Name: Nandhakumar RajuEmail: Send EmailOrganization: My Ayur Health LLCAddress: 21138 Dray Terrace, Ashburn, Virginia 20147Phone: +1-612-203-7355Website: https://myayurhealth.com/ Release ID: 89156156 If there are any deficiencies, problems, or concerns regarding the information presented in this press release that require attention or if you need assistance with a press release takedown, we encourage you to notify us without delay at error@releasecontact.com (it is important to note that this email is the authorized channel for such matters, sending multiple emails to multiple addresses does not necessarily help expedite your request). Our diligent team is committed to promptly addressing your concerns within 8 hours and taking necessary actions to rectify any identified issues or facilitate the removal process. HCA Healthcare Announces $1.84 Million HCA Healthcare Foundation Grant to United Way
Source: Business Wire    Published: 2025-03-25 12:30:00

HCA Healthcare Announces $1.84 Million HCA Healthcare Foundation Grant to United Way NASHVILLE, Tenn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--HCA Healthcare, Inc. (NYSE:HCA), one of the nation's leading healthcare providers, today announced that the HCA Healthcare Foundation, through its Healthier Tomorrow Fund, will give $1.84 million to Mile High United Way to launch United for Healthy Starts, a national collaboration between four United Ways to help increase access to social, economic and educational support services for families. The effort is led by Mile High United Way in Denver and includes United Way of Metropolitan Dallas, United Way Miami and United Way of Greater Nashville. “It's a privilege to help champion the overall health and well-being of families through United for Healthy Starts,” said Joanne Pulles, vice president of community engagement at HCA Healthcare and president of the HCA Healthcare Foundation. “Meaningful community impact can be made when organizations come together to support and learn from one another. We are excited and expect to see a positive influence from this United Way initiative across the country, as we work together to help give communities healthier tomorrows.” United for Healthy Starts aims to increase access to services to improve social, economic and overall health outcomes for families. Through this new grant, the initiative is designed to help families have strong, healthy starts through home visitation and wrap-around services tailored to the needs of each family supported. By establishing a national, collaborative learning community, United for Healthy Starts will also work to help create new nonprofit partnerships, with the intention of strengthening service delivery and innovation and achieving a scalable impact beyond the grant. "We are thrilled to continue this longstanding collaboration between two historic anchor institutions committed to improving the lives of families – HCA Healthcare and United Way,” said Christine Benero, Mile High United Way president and CEO. “Through United for Healthy Starts, HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation are truly putting a stake in the ground for mothers and young children, especially those facing barriers to healthy outcomes. This important grant in the Denver, Dallas, Nashville and Miami communities will help our work to develop new innovations in home visitation and support, and we hope the learnings will allow us to bring this model to more communities in the future.” HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation have a long history of working with and supporting United Way. In 1981, HCA Healthcare co-founder Dr. Thomas Frist Jr. co-founded the first chapter of the Alexis de Tocqueville Society in Nashville, Tennessee and later received its Lifetime Achievement Award in 2012. Over the last 30 years, HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation have given more than $17 million in support of United Way's work to help improve communities nationwide. The HCA Healthcare Foundation's Healthier Tomorrow Fund supports evidence-informed programs that address high-priority needs and advance community health by supporting efforts to pilot, replicate and scale meaningful, measurable initiatives in communities where HCA Healthcare has a presence. Since its inception, the fund has committed more than $17 million in grants to nonprofits across the country. About HCA Healthcare Foundation The mission of the HCA Healthcare Foundation is to promote health and well-being and strive to make a positive impact in all the communities HCA Healthcare serves. We accomplish this mission by providing leadership, service and financial support to effective non-profit organizations working individually and collectively. About HCA Healthcare Nashville-based HCA Healthcare is one of the nation's leading providers of healthcare services comprising 190 hospitals and approximately 2,400 ambulatory sites of care, including surgery centers, freestanding ERs, urgent care centers, and physician clinics, in 20 states and the United Kingdom. With its founding in 1968, HCA Healthcare created a new model for hospital care in the United States, using combined resources to strengthen hospitals, deliver patient-focused care and improve the practice of medicine. HCA Healthcare has conducted a number of clinical studies, including one that demonstrated that full-term delivery is healthier than early elective delivery of babies and another that identified a clinical protocol that can reduce bloodstream infections in ICU patients by 44%. HCA Healthcare is a learning health system that uses its approximately 44 million annual patient encounters to advance science, improve patient care and save lives. All references to “Company,” “HCA” and “HCA Healthcare” as used throughout this document refer to HCA Healthcare, Inc. and its affiliates. HCA Healthcare's $1.84M Grant Powers Game-Changing Health Access Program Across 4 Major Cities
Source: StockTitan    Published: 2025-03-25 12:30:00

Predictive Oncology Successfully Develops Predictive Models Deriv... Desktop Metal Announces Delaware Court of Chancery Orders Nano Di... DatChat Launches Myseum Social Media Platform for Apple iOS and A... Alliance Entertainment Wins Bid to Acquire Key Assets from Diamon... CorMedix Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial... Mural Oncology Provides Update on Phase 3 ARTISTRY-7 Trial of Nem... Predictive Oncology Successfully Develops Predictive Models Deriv... Desktop Metal Announces Delaware Court of Chancery Orders Nano Di... DatChat Launches Myseum Social Media Platform for Apple iOS and A... Alliance Entertainment Wins Bid to Acquire Key Assets from Diamon... CorMedix Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial... Mural Oncology Provides Update on Phase 3 ARTISTRY-7 Trial of Nem... HCA Healthcare Foundation has announced a $1.84 million grant to Mile High United Way through its Healthier Tomorrow Fund to launch United for Healthy Starts, a national collaboration between four United Ways. The initiative, involving United Ways in Denver, Dallas, Miami, and Nashville, aims to increase access to social, economic, and educational support services for families through home visitation and wrap-around services. The program focuses on creating a national collaborative learning community to strengthen service delivery and achieve scalable impact. HCA Healthcare and its Foundation have a long-standing relationship with United Way, contributing over $17 million in support over the last 30 years. The Healthier Tomorrow Fund has committed more than $17 million in grants to various nonprofits across the country since its inception. HCA Healthcare Foundation ha annunciato un contributo di 1,84 milioni di dollari a Mile High United Way attraverso il suo Healthier Tomorrow Fund per lanciare United for Healthy Starts, una collaborazione nazionale tra quattro United Ways. L'iniziativa, che coinvolge gli United Ways di Denver, Dallas, Miami e Nashville, mira ad aumentare l'accesso ai servizi di supporto sociale, economico ed educativo per le famiglie attraverso visite domiciliari e servizi integrati. Il programma si concentra sulla creazione di una comunità di apprendimento collaborativa nazionale per rafforzare la fornitura di servizi e ottenere un impatto scalabile. HCA Healthcare e la sua Fondazione hanno una lunga relazione con United Way, contribuendo con oltre 17 milioni di dollari di supporto negli ultimi 30 anni. Il Healthier Tomorrow Fund ha impegnato più di 17 milioni di dollari in sovvenzioni a varie organizzazioni non profit in tutto il paese dalla sua creazione. HCA Healthcare Foundation ha anunciado una a Mile High United Way a través de su Healthier Tomorrow Fund para lanzar United for Healthy Starts, una colaboración nacional entre cuatro United Ways. La iniciativa, que involucra a los United Ways de Denver, Dallas, Miami y Nashville, tiene como objetivo aumentar el acceso a servicios de apoyo social, económico y educativo para las familias a través de visitas domiciliarias y servicios integrales. El programa se centra en crear una comunidad de aprendizaje colaborativo a nivel nacional para fortalecer la entrega de servicios y lograr un impacto escalable. HCA Healthcare y su Fundación tienen una larga relación con United Way, contribuyendo con más de 17 millones de dólares en apoyo durante los últimos 30 años. El Healthier Tomorrow Fund ha comprometido más de 17 millones de dólares en subvenciones a diversas organizaciones sin fines de lucro en todo el país desde su creación. HCA Healthcare Foundation는 184만 달러의 보조금을 Mile High United Way에 발표했습니다. 이는 Healthier Tomorrow Fund를 통해 United for Healthy Starts를 시작하기 위한 것입니다. 이 이니셔티브는 덴버, 댈러스, 마이애미 및 내슈빌의 United Way를 포함하여 가족을 위한 사회적, 경제적, 교육적 지원 서비스에 대한 접근을 증가시키는 것을 목표로 합니다. 이는 가정 방문 및 종합 서비스 제공을 통해 이루어집니다. 이 프로그램은 서비스 제공을 강화하고 확장 가능한 영향을 달성하기 위한 국가적 협력 학습 공동체를 만드는 데 중점을 두고 있습니다. HCA Healthcare와 그 재단은 United Way와 오랜 관계를 유지하고 있으며, 지난 30년 동안 1,700만 달러 이상을 지원했습니다. Healthier Tomorrow Fund는 설립 이후로 미국 전역의 다양한 비영리 단체에 1,700만 달러 이상의 보조금을 약속했습니다. HCA Healthcare Foundation a annoncé une subvention de 1,84 million de dollars à Mile High United Way via son Healthier Tomorrow Fund pour lancer United for Healthy Starts, une collaboration nationale entre quatre United Ways. L'initiative, impliquant les United Ways de Denver, Dallas, Miami et Nashville, vise à accroître l'accès aux services de soutien social, économique et éducatif pour les familles grâce à des visites à domicile et des services complets. Le programme met l'accent sur la création d'une communauté d'apprentissage collaborative nationale pour renforcer la prestation de services et atteindre un impact évolutif. HCA Healthcare et sa fondation entretiennent une relation de longue date avec United Way, ayant contribué à hauteur de plus de 17 millions de dollars de soutien au cours des 30 dernières années. Le Healthier Tomorrow Fund a engagé plus de 17 millions de dollars en subventions à diverses organisations à but non lucratif à travers le pays depuis sa création. HCA Healthcare Foundation hat einen Grant in Höhe von 1,84 Millionen Dollar an Mile High United Way über den Healthier Tomorrow Fund angekündigt, um United for Healthy Starts zu starten, eine nationale Zusammenarbeit zwischen vier United Ways. Die Initiative, die die United Ways in Denver, Dallas, Miami und Nashville einbezieht, zielt darauf ab, den Zugang zu sozialen, wirtschaftlichen und Bildungsunterstützungsdiensten für Familien durch Hausbesuche und integrierte Dienstleistungen zu erhöhen. Das Programm konzentriert sich darauf, eine nationale kollaborative Lern-Community zu schaffen, um die Dienstleistungserbringung zu stärken und einen skalierbaren Einfluss zu erzielen. HCA Healthcare und seine Stiftung haben eine langjährige Beziehung zu United Way und haben in den letzten 30 Jahren über 17 Millionen Dollar an Unterstützung beigetragen. Der Healthier Tomorrow Fund hat seit seiner Gründung über 17 Millionen Dollar an Zuschüssen an verschiedene gemeinnützige Organisationen im ganzen Land vergeben. NASHVILLE, Tenn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- HCA Healthcare, Inc. (NYSE:HCA), one of the nation's leading healthcare providers, today announced that the HCA Healthcare Foundation, through its Healthier Tomorrow Fund, will give $1.84 million to Mile High United Way to launch United for Healthy Starts, a national collaboration between four United Ways to help increase access to social, economic and educational support services for families. The effort is led by Mile High United Way in Denver and includes United Way of Metropolitan Dallas, United Way Miami and United Way of Greater Nashville. “It's a privilege to help champion the overall health and well-being of families through United for Healthy Starts,” said Joanne Pulles, vice president of community engagement at HCA Healthcare and president of the HCA Healthcare Foundation. “Meaningful community impact can be made when organizations come together to support and learn from one another. We are excited and expect to see a positive influence from this United Way initiative across the country, as we work together to help give communities healthier tomorrows.” United for Healthy Starts aims to increase access to services to improve social, economic and overall health outcomes for families. Through this new grant, the initiative is designed to help families have strong, healthy starts through home visitation and wrap-around services tailored to the needs of each family supported. By establishing a national, collaborative learning community, United for Healthy Starts will also work to help create new nonprofit partnerships, with the intention of strengthening service delivery and innovation and achieving a scalable impact beyond the grant. "We are thrilled to continue this longstanding collaboration between two historic anchor institutions committed to improving the lives of families – HCA Healthcare and United Way,” said Christine Benero, Mile High United Way president and CEO. “Through United for Healthy Starts, HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation are truly putting a stake in the ground for mothers and young children, especially those facing barriers to healthy outcomes. This important grant in the Denver, Dallas, Nashville and Miami communities will help our work to develop new innovations in home visitation and support, and we hope the learnings will allow us to bring this model to more communities in the future.” HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation have a long history of working with and supporting United Way. In 1981, HCA Healthcare co-founder Dr. Thomas Frist Jr. co-founded the first chapter of the Alexis de Tocqueville Society in Nashville, Tennessee and later received its Lifetime Achievement Award in 2012. Over the last 30 years, HCA Healthcare and the HCA Healthcare Foundation have given more than $17 million in support of United Way's work to help improve communities nationwide. The HCA Healthcare Foundation's Healthier Tomorrow Fund supports evidence-informed programs that address high-priority needs and advance community health by supporting efforts to pilot, replicate and scale meaningful, measurable initiatives in communities where HCA Healthcare has a presence. Since its inception, the fund has committed more than $17 million in grants to nonprofits across the country. About HCA Healthcare Foundation The mission of the HCA Healthcare Foundation is to promote health and well-being and strive to make a positive impact in all the communities HCA Healthcare serves. We accomplish this mission by providing leadership, service and financial support to effective non-profit organizations working individually and collectively. About HCA Healthcare Nashville-based HCA Healthcare is one of the nation's leading providers of healthcare services comprising 190 hospitals and approximately 2,400 ambulatory sites of care, including surgery centers, freestanding ERs, urgent care centers, and physician clinics, in 20 states and the United Kingdom. With its founding in 1968, HCA Healthcare created a new model for hospital care in the United States, using combined resources to strengthen hospitals, deliver patient-focused care and improve the practice of medicine. HCA Healthcare has conducted a number of clinical studies, including one that demonstrated that full-term delivery is healthier than early elective delivery of babies and another that identified a clinical protocol that can reduce bloodstream infections in ICU patients by 44%. HCA Healthcare is a learning health system that uses its approximately 44 million annual patient encounters to advance science, improve patient care and save lives. All references to “Company,” “HCA” and “HCA Healthcare” as used throughout this document refer to HCA Healthcare, Inc. and its affiliates. Healthcare Tech Leader Spok Claims Triple Crown in Black Book Rankings
Source: StockTitan    Published: 2025-03-25 12:30:00

Predictive Oncology Successfully Develops Predictive Models Deriv... Desktop Metal Announces Delaware Court of Chancery Orders Nano Di... DatChat Launches Myseum Social Media Platform for Apple iOS and A... Alliance Entertainment Wins Bid to Acquire Key Assets from Diamon... CorMedix Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial... Mural Oncology Provides Update on Phase 3 ARTISTRY-7 Trial of Nem... Predictive Oncology Successfully Develops Predictive Models Deriv... Desktop Metal Announces Delaware Court of Chancery Orders Nano Di... DatChat Launches Myseum Social Media Platform for Apple iOS and A... Alliance Entertainment Wins Bid to Acquire Key Assets from Diamon... CorMedix Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial... Mural Oncology Provides Update on Phase 3 ARTISTRY-7 Trial of Nem... Spok Holdings (NASDAQ: SPOK) has achieved top rankings in the 2025 Black Book survey for the eighth consecutive year in healthcare IT categories. The company secured the #1 position in both secure messaging and clinical communications solutions, and for the first time, led in critical alert messaging and management solutions. Spok excelled in 12 out of 18 key performance indicators for secure messaging and clinical communications, including messaging delivery speed, implementation ease, interoperability, and clinical workflow integration. The company also topped the new critical alert category in metrics such as alert accuracy, clinician adoption rate, customer support, and impact on patient safety outcomes. Spok Holdings (NASDAQ: SPOK) ha raggiunto i primi posti nella survey Black Book 2025 per l'ottavo anno consecutivo nelle categorie IT sanitarie. L'azienda si è assicurata la posizione numero 1 sia nelle soluzioni di messaggistica sicura che nelle comunicazioni cliniche, e per la prima volta ha guidato anche nelle soluzioni di messaggistica e gestione degli avvisi critici. Spok ha eccelso in 12 su 18 indicatori chiave di prestazione per la messaggistica sicura e le comunicazioni cliniche, inclusi la velocità di consegna dei messaggi, la facilità di implementazione, l'interoperabilità e l'integrazione nei flussi di lavoro clinici. L'azienda ha anche dominato la nuova categoria degli avvisi critici in metriche come l'accuratezza degli avvisi, il tasso di adozione da parte dei clinici, il supporto clienti e l'impatto sui risultati di sicurezza dei pazienti. Spok Holdings (NASDAQ: SPOK) ha alcanzado las mejores posiciones en la encuesta Black Book 2025 por octavo año consecutivo en categorías de TI en salud. La empresa ocupó la posición número 1 tanto en mensajería segura como en soluciones de comunicaciones clínicas, y por primera vez lideró en mensajería y gestión de alertas críticas. Spok destacó en 12 de 18 indicadores clave de rendimiento para mensajería segura y comunicaciones clínicas, incluyendo la velocidad de entrega de mensajes, la facilidad de implementación, la interoperabilidad y la integración en los flujos de trabajo clínicos. La empresa también encabezó la nueva categoría de alertas críticas en métricas como la precisión de las alertas, la tasa de adopción de los clínicos, el soporte al cliente y el impacto en los resultados de seguridad del paciente. 스포크 홀딩스 (NASDAQ: SPOK)는 2025 블랙 북 조사에서 의료 IT 분야에서 8년 연속 최고 순위를 달성했습니다. 이 회사는 안전한 메시징과 임상 커뮤니케이션 솔루션 모두에서 1위를 차지했으며, 처음으로 중요한 알림 메시징 및 관리 솔루션에서도 선두를 달렸습니다. 스포크는 안전한 메시징 및 임상 커뮤니케이션을 위한 18개 핵심 성과 지표 중 12개에서 뛰어난 성과를 보였으며, 여기에는 메시지 전달 속도, 구현 용이성, 상호 운용성 및 임상 워크플로 통합이 포함됩니다. 이 회사는 또한 알림 정확도, 임상의 채택률, 고객 지원 및 환자 안전 결과에 미치는 영향과 같은 지표에서 새로운 중요한 알림 범주에서도 1위를 차지했습니다. Spok Holdings (NASDAQ: SPOK) a atteint les meilleures positions dans l'enquête Black Book 2025 pour la huitième année consécutive dans les catégories de l'informatique de santé. L'entreprise a obtenu la première place tant dans les solutions de messagerie sécurisée que dans les communications cliniques, et pour la première fois, elle a été en tête dans les solutions de messagerie et de gestion des alertes critiques. Spok a excellé dans 12 des 18 indicateurs clés de performance pour la messagerie sécurisée et les communications cliniques, y compris la rapidité de livraison des messages, la facilité d'implémentation, l'interopérabilité et l'intégration dans les flux de travail cliniques. L'entreprise a également dominé la nouvelle catégorie des alertes critiques dans des métriques telles que la précision des alertes, le taux d'adoption des cliniciens, le support client et l'impact sur les résultats de sécurité des patients. Spok Holdings (NASDAQ: SPOK) hat im Black Book 2025 zum achten Mal in Folge Spitzenplätze in den Kategorien Gesundheits-IT erreicht. Das Unternehmen sicherte sich die Nummer 1 sowohl in der sicheren Nachrichtenübermittlung als auch in klinischen Kommunikationslösungen und führte zum ersten Mal im Bereich kritischer Alarmnachricht und Managementlösungen. Spok glänzte in 12 von 18 Schlüssel-Leistungsindikatoren für sichere Nachrichtenübermittlung und klinische Kommunikation, darunter die Geschwindigkeit der Nachrichtenübermittlung, die Implementierung, Interoperabilität und die Integration in klinische Arbeitsabläufe. Das Unternehmen führte auch in der neuen Kategorie kritischer Alarme in Metriken wie Alarmgenauigkeit, Akzeptanzrate bei Klinikern, Kundenservice und Einfluss auf die Patientensicherheitsergebnisse. In the 2025 Black Book survey, Spok ranks No. 1 in two healthcare IT categories PLANO, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Spok, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Spok Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: SPOK) and a leader in healthcare communications, earned top honors for the eighth consecutive year in a survey of healthcare industry clients by Black Book Market Research on top-rated secure messaging and clinical communications solutions. For the first time, Spok has also been recognized as the leading performer of critical alert messaging and management solutions. “At Spok, we are truly privileged to be entrusted by our healthcare partners with supporting their clinical communication needs,” said Vincent D. Kelly, chief executive officer of Spok Holdings, Inc. “This incredible milestone demonstrates our steadfast commitment to delivering robust and reliable technology that removes barriers to exceptional patient experiences and care.” Spok received the highest honors for customer satisfaction in 12 of the 18 key performance indicators that Black Book Research measures for secure messaging and clinical communications solutions, including messaging delivery speed and reliability, ease of implementation and deployment, interoperability and standards compliance, and clinical workflow integration and optimization. For the new category of critical alert messaging and management solutions, Spok received the top-rated spot for individual key performance metrics such as alert accuracy and relevance, usability and adoption rate by clinicians and staff, customer support and vendor responsiveness, and impact on patient safety and clinical outcomes. Black Book Market Research LLC measures customer satisfaction for secure messaging and clinical communications solutions across 18 operational excellence key performance indicators: Messaging Delivery Speed & Reliability; Ease of Implementation & Deployment; Interoperability & Standards Compliance; Vendor-Agnostic System Compatibility; Clinical Workflow Integration & Optimization; Customizability & Role-Based Configuration; Data Accuracy, Integrity & Auditability; Real-Time Notifications & Alerting Efficiency; User Interface & Mobile Usability; End-to-End Encryption & Data Security; Access Control & Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA); Scalability & Future-Proofing; Data Governance & Secure Message Retention; AI-Powered Smart Messaging & Workflow Automation; Predictive Analytics & Clinical Insights; Cost-Effectiveness & ROI Perception; Vendor Support & Responsiveness; and Market Leadership & Innovation Differentiation. The five individual key performances for critical alert messaging and management solutions are Clinical Workflow Impact & Efficiency, Usability & Adoption Rate by Clinicians and Staff, Alert Accuracy and Relevance, Customer Support & Vendor Responsiveness, Impact on Patient Safety & Clinical Outcomes. Black Book's independent user surveys aim to inform healthcare technology buyers about vendors that exceed expectations, as rated by current and former customers across all organizational user levels. For methodology, auditing, resources, comprehensive research, and ranking data, see http://blackbookmarketresearch.com. About Spok Spok, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Spok Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: SPOK), headquartered in Plano, Texas, is proud to be a global leader in healthcare communications. We deliver clinical information to care teams when and where it matters most to improve patient outcomes. Top hospitals rely on the Spok Care Connect® platform to enhance workflows for clinicians and support administrative compliance. Our customers send over 70 million messages each month through their Spok® solutions. Spok enables smarter, faster clinical communication. For more information, visit spok.com. Spok is a trademark of Spok Holdings, Inc. Spok Care Connect and Spok Mobile are trademarks of Spok, Inc. Evolus to Participate in The Needham 24th Annual Virtual Healthcare Conference
Source: Business Wire    Published: 2025-03-25 12:00:00

Evolus to Participate in The Needham 24th Annual Virtual Healthcare Conference NEWPORT BEACH, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Evolus, Inc. (NASDAQ: EOLS), a performance beauty company with a focus on building an aesthetic portfolio, today announced that members of its management team will participate in a fireside chat and investor meetings at the upcoming Needham Annual Virtual Healthcare Conference. The fireside chat will take place on Tuesday, April 8, 2025, at 12:45 PM ET - Track 1. The fireside chats can be accessed on the Investor Relations page of the Evolus website here. A replay of the webcast will be available for 90 days after the date of each presentation. About Evolus, Inc. Evolus (NASDAQ: EOLS) is a global performance beauty company redefining the aesthetic injectable market for the next generation of beauty consumers through its unique, customer-centric business model and innovative digital platform. Our mission is to become a global leader in aesthetics anchored by our flagship products: Jeuveau® (prabotulinumtoxinA-xvfs), the first and only neurotoxin dedicated exclusively to aesthetics, and Evolysse™, a collection of unique injectable hyaluronic acid (HA) gels. Visit us at www.evolus.com, and follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram or Facebook. Jeuveau® and Nuceiva®, are registered trademarks and Evolysse™ is a trademark of Evolus, Inc. Investors: Nareg Sagherian, Vice President, Head of Global Investor Relations and Corporate Communications Phone: (248) 202-9267 Email: ir@evolus.com Media: Email: media@evolus.com Investors: Nareg Sagherian, Vice President, Head of Global Investor Relations and Corporate Communications Phone: (248) 202-9267 Email: ir@evolus.com Media: Email: media@evolus.com Investors: Nareg Sagherian, Vice President, Head of Global Investor Relations and Corporate Communications Phone: (248) 202-9267 Email: ir@evolus.com Media: Email: media@evolus.com © 2025 Business Wire, Inc.

How Is Molina Healthcare's Stock Performance Compared to Other Health Care Services Stocks?
Source: TradingView    Published: 2025-03-25 11:57:05

Long Beach, California-based Molina Healthcare, Inc. MOH provides managed healthcare services to low-income families and individuals under the Medicaid and Medicare programs and through the state insurance marketplaces. Valued at a market cap of $17.1 billion, the company participates exclusively in government-sponsored healthcare programs. Companies worth $10 billion or more are typically classified as “large-cap stocks,” and Molina fits the label perfectly, with its market cap exceeding this threshold, underscoring its size, influence, and dominance within the healthcare plans industry. The company operates with a cost-efficient business model, focusing on streamlined healthcare delivery to maintain strong profit margins. With a broad geographic presence across multiple U.S. states, the company continues to expand its reach while leveraging strategic acquisitions and operational efficiency to strengthen its market position. Despite its notable strength, this healthcare company has dipped 26.2% from its 52-week high of $423.92, reached on Mar. 27, 2024. It has gained 5.9% over the past three months, lagging behind the SPDR S&P Health Care Services ETF's XHS 8.7% uptick over the same time frame. In the longer term, MOH has fallen 24.6% over the past 52 weeks, considerably underperforming XHS' 7.3% rise over the same time frame. Moreover, on a YTD basis, shares of MOH are up 7.4%, compared to XHS' 9.5% return. To confirm its recent bullish trend, MOH has been trading above its 50-day moving average since late February. However, it has remained below its 200-day moving average since late April, with some fluctuations. On Feb. 5, MOH released its mixed Q4 results, and its stock plummeted 10.1% the following day. While adjusted earnings rose 15.3% year-over-year to $5.05 per share, it fell 13.1% short of Wall Street expectations. Rising medical care costs, lower investment income, and weaker-than-expected membership growth further weighed on investor sentiment and led to its earnings miss. However, on the brighter side, higher premium revenues and new contract acquisitions resulted in a 16% increase in its revenue to $10.5 billion, which met analyst estimates. For fiscal 2025, MOH expects adjusted EPS to be at least $24.50, representing an approximately 8% growth compared to the previous year. MOH has lagged behind its rival, UnitedHealth Group Incorporated's UNH 5.4% gain over the past 52 weeks but has outpaced UNH's 2.1% rise on a YTD basis. Despite MOH's recent underperformance relative to its industry peers, analysts remain moderately optimistic about its prospects. The stock has a consensus rating of “Moderate Buy” from the 14 analysts covering it, and the mean price target of $343.46 suggests a nearly 9.9% premium to its current levels. On the date of publication, Neharika Jain did not have (either directly or indirectly) positions in any of the securities mentioned in this article. Cooper Companies Stock: Is COO Underperforming the Healthcare Sector?
Source: TradingView    Published: 2025-03-25 11:51:20

Valued at a market cap of $16.8 billion, The Cooper Companies, Inc. COO is a specialty medical device company that develops, manufactures, and markets contact lens wearers. The San Ramon, California-based company's products are primarily designed for solving vision challenges like astigmatism, presbyopia and ocular dryness. Companies valued at $10 billion or more are typically classified as “large-cap stocks,” and COO fits the label perfectly, with its market cap exceeding this threshold, underscoring its size, influence, and dominance within the medical instruments & supplies industry. With a strong global presence in over 100 countries, the company benefits from steady demand and a recession-resistant business model. It drives growth through continuous innovation and strategic acquisitions, expanding its product portfolio and market reach. Despite its notable strength, this vision care company has slipped 25.2% from its 52-week high of $112.38, reached on Sep. 16, 2024. Moreover, it has declined 9.4% over the past three months, considerably lagging behind the broader Health Care Select Sector SPDR Fund's XLV 5.6% gain over the same time frame. In the longer term, COO has declined 16.3% over the past 52 weeks, underperforming XLV's 1.2% rise over the same time frame. Moreover, on a YTD basis, shares of COO are down nearly 8.6%, compared to XLV's 7% uptick. To confirm its bearish trend, COO has been trading below its 200-day moving average since mid-December, 2024, with slight fluctuations, and has remained below its 50-day moving average since late October, 2024, experiencing some fluctuations. On Mar. 6, COO released its Q1 earnings results, leading to a 6.6% drop in its stock price the following day. The decline came as the company reported revenue of $964.7 million, which, despite growing 3.6% year-over-year, fell 1.6% short of analyst expectations. A key factor contributing to this revenue miss was a decline in CooperVision's Asia-Pacific revenue on a reported basis. However, on a positive note, adjusted earnings rose 8.2% year-over-year to $0.92 per share, surpassing the consensus estimate of $0.91. This earnings beat was supported by an increase in both adjusted gross and operating profit margins, reflecting improved efficiency and cost management. Looking ahead, for fiscal 2025, the company expects adjusted EPS between $3.94 and $4.02, and anticipates revenue in the range of $4.1 billion to $4.2 billion, representing organic growth of 6% to 8%. The Cooper Companies' underperformance looks even more pronounced when compared to its rival, Alcon Inc. ALC, which gained 10.5% over the past 52 weeks and 8.8% on a YTD basis. Despite COO's recent underperformance relative to its broader sector, analysts remain moderately bullish about its prospects. The stock has a consensus rating of “Moderate Buy” from the 16 analysts covering it, and the mean price target of $110.36 suggests an ambitious 31.3% premium to its current levels. On the date of publication, Neharika Jain did not have (either directly or indirectly) positions in any of the securities mentioned in this article. Tackling the Ransomware Pandemic: Healthcare Security Leaders Team Up with OnDefend for a New Defensive Approach
Source: Yahoo Finance    Published: 2025-03-25 11:45:00

Oops, something went wrong A collaboration with hospital systems and their leaders, OnDefend's new Ransomware Defense Validation service reimagines defense strategies through proactive and continuous security control validation. JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 25, 2025--(BUSINESS WIRE)--OnDefend, a leader in preventative cybersecurity testing and advisory services, today announced the launch of its Ransomware Defense Validation (RDV) service. Developed with direct input from prominent healthcare Chief Information Security Officers (CISOs) and launched in collaboration with major healthcare systems, RDV addresses the pressing need for organizations to proactively defend against ransomware threats. The healthcare community faces a new pandemic—a cyber one—and the risks to patient safety, data security, and operational continuity have never been greater. As a managed service, RDV, powered by BlindSPOT, OnDefend's proprietary Breach and Attack Simulation (BAS) platform, equips organizations to regularly test and validate the effectiveness of their prevention, detection, and response security controls against known and emerging threats. Data collected from OnDefend's global security testing services found: 24% of malicious emails bypass Secure Email Gateways (SEGs). 7 out of 10 attack simulation engagements identify exploitable security tool failures. 5 out of 10 incident emulations identify notification delays or failure to meet Service Level Agreements (SLA) between the response vendors. A Collaborative Approach to Solving an Industry-Wide Challenge RDV originated from conversations between OnDefend's security teams and healthcare leaders who shared concerns about common security control failures and the lack of regular visibility and validation. "Cybersecurity isn't about setting up defenses and hoping for the best. It's about constantly testing, adapting, and staying ahead of threats. If you're not testing your security, the attackers will do it for you," said Larry Whiteside Jr., former CISO at Spectrum Health and Women's Care OBGYN. These discussions highlighted the need for a proactive solution tailored to the unique challenges of healthcare cybersecurity, going above and beyond current healthcare standards and regulations. How Ransomware Defense Validation (RDV) Works RDV is delivered by OnDefend as a managed service using BlindSPOT to safely simulate real-world ransomware attacks on a healthcare systems' defenses to prove their: Secure Email Gateways (SEGs): effectively filter malicious emails from reaching employee inboxes. Threat Detection Tools (EDR, SIEM): effectively identify and alert security teams to real-world attack activity. Threat Response Teams (SOC,MDR,NDR): immediately respond and neutralize real-world cyber threats in real-time. "Ransomware Defense Validation provides security leaders with critical visibility into their defensive investments, ensuring they are resilient against the cyber threats targeting their industry," said Chris Freedman, CEO of OnDefend. "The goal of this managed service is to validate security tools and hold monitoring vendors accountable, all while empowering our customers to demonstrate they are achieving the return on investment they deserve." RDV Outcomes & Industry Impact Early access customers who implemented RDV found their security teams' overall posture improved, showcased continuous risk reduction, proved return on investments, and are prepared to safeguard essential healthcare operations. This service is now available to healthcare organizations nationwide. Learn More To further understand Ransomware Defense Validation, we invite you to explore our additional resources here: https://ondefend.com/blindspot/ransomware-defense-validation/ About OnDefend OnDefend, established in 2016, stands at the forefront of preventative cybersecurity testing and advisory services, a reputation further enhanced by the introduction of BlindSPOT, its advanced Breach and Attack Simulation (BAS) Software as a Service (SaaS) platform. OnDefend is a trusted partner, empowering organizations globally to combat real-world cyber threats proactively. From ensuring compliance with industry standards to building out mature security programs, our mission is to ensure that the security resources our customers invest in are well-utilized, effective, and provide tangible results. For more information about our services and solutions, please visit www.ondefend.com. OnDefend on Social Media LinkedIn Twitter (@OnDefend) View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250325126693/en/ Contacts OnDefend Media Contact:Lauren VernoMedia@ondefend.com 904-299-3669

SEHTA Healthcare Business Awards recognizes Bedfont® Scientific Limited for innovation
Source: News-Medical.Net    Published: 2025-03-25 11:20:00

World leaders in breath analysis are named finalists for the SEHTA innovation category. Image Credit: Bedfont Scientific Bedfont® Scientific Limited are thrilled to have been selected as a finalist in the Innovation category at the South East Health Technologies Alliance (SEHTA) Awards 2025. The SEHTA Awards celebrate excellence in health technology innovation and acknowledge the outstanding collaborations among industry, academia, and the NHS across the South East of England. This recognition highlights Bedfont's commitment to advancing innovation in breath analysis. With over 48 years of knowledge and expertise in designing and manufacturing breath analysis devices, Bedfont® has continued to improve its devices to keep up with technology and market trends, and evolve and improve its internal company processes. We are incredibly honoured to be recognized as finalists in the SEHTA Awards 2025. This acknowledgement reinforces our dedication to pushing the boundaries of innovation and delivering transformative solutions in breath analysis. We look forward to the awards ceremony and celebrating innovation alongside other industry leaders." Jason Smith, CEO, Bedfont® The winners will be announced at the SEHTA Awards Ceremony, which will be held on Thursday, April 10th, at the London Institute for Healthcare Engineering. The evening will unite businesses to showcase healthcare innovation and collaboration excellence contributions.
